title: [docs] Disable google indexing of old docs
body_html:
Was googling "pytorch" "adaptive_max_pool2d". Found this:

torch.nn — PyTorch master documentation
pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html
... max_pool2d; max_pool3d; max_unpool1d; max_unpool2d; max_unpool3d; lp_pool2d; adaptive_max_pool1d; adaptive_max_pool2d; adaptive_max_pool3d ...
‎Torch.nn.functional · ‎Torch.optim · ‎Torch.nn.modules.loss · ‎Torch.nn.modules.rnn

torch.nn — PyTorch 0.1.12_2 documentation
pytorch.org/docs/0.1.12/nn.html
Parameters¶. class torch.nn. Parameter [source]¶. A kind of Variable that is to be considered a module parameter. Parameters are Variable subclasses, that have ...

torch.nn — PyTorch master documentation
pytorch.org/docs/0.2.0/nn.html
... max_unpool2d; max_unpool3d; lp_pool2d; adaptive_max_pool1d; adaptive_max_pool2d; adaptive_avg_pool1d; adaptive_avg_pool2d. Non-linear activation ...

Concerned about:

  1. Very old docs from 0.1.2 indexed together with 0.2.0 and master
  2. Master doc pointing to 0.2.0 for the last hit, inconsistent

This was discussed at an earlier point in #1124. Old docs found in Google create confusion (for OpenCV this is a very big problem, hard to find the docs of the most recent versions and to tell if the found docs are recent or not).

body:
Was googling `"pytorch" "adaptive_max_pool2d"`. Found this:
```
torch.nn — PyTorch master documentation
pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html
... max_pool2d; max_pool3d; max_unpool1d; max_unpool2d; max_unpool3d; lp_pool2d; adaptive_max_pool1d; adaptive_max_pool2d; adaptive_max_pool3d ...
‎Torch.nn.functional · ‎Torch.optim · ‎Torch.nn.modules.loss · ‎Torch.nn.modules.rnn

torch.nn — PyTorch 0.1.12_2 documentation
pytorch.org/docs/0.1.12/nn.html
Parameters¶. class torch.nn. Parameter [source]¶. A kind of Variable that is to be considered a module parameter. Parameters are Variable subclasses, that have ...

torch.nn — PyTorch master documentation
pytorch.org/docs/0.2.0/nn.html
... max_unpool2d; max_unpool3d; lp_pool2d; adaptive_max_pool1d; adaptive_max_pool2d; adaptive_avg_pool1d; adaptive_avg_pool2d. Non-linear activation ...
```

Concerned about:
1. Very old docs from 0.1.2 indexed together with 0.2.0 and master
2. Master doc pointing to 0.2.0 for the last hit, inconsistent

This was discussed at an earlier point in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/1124. Old docs found in Google create confusion (for OpenCV this is a very big problem, hard to find the docs of the most recent versions and to tell if the found docs are recent or not).
